annotations.reason: Vague statements about doing good post-scandal, Thought-terminating Clichés.
annotations.text: I have tried to do a good job since then with my life and with my work.

annotations.reason: Focusing on the race of Quentin Lamar Smith without clear relevance to the issue at hand.
annotations.text: Thanks for publicizing the race of Quentin Lamar Smith.

annotations.reason: Emphasizing the race of Quentin Lamar Smith as if it were inherently meaningful or explanatory.
annotations.text: VDARE.com was the first news organization to make his race known, even though he was well known to law enforcement.

annotations.reason: Labeling Fox News as controlled opposition.
annotations.text: Fox News is largely controlled opposition despite what many may think.

annotations.reason: Minimizing the presence of conservatives and exaggerating liberals.
annotations.text: Other than that, they have liberals and neo-cons running rampant.

annotations.reason: Obfuscating the legal argument regarding press passes.

annotations.text: take our poll - story continues below

annotations.reason: Labeling Fox as not fair and balanced.
annotations.text: In a statement by Fox News President Jay Wallace, he wrote:

annotations.reason: Using John McCain's concern to instill fear or anxiety about Gina Haspel's nomination.
annotations.text: Even John McCain is worried about Trump’s CIA pick

annotations.reason: Emotional language used to describe the torture as one of the darkest chapters in American history.
annotations.text: the torture of detainees in U.S. custody during the last decade was one of the darkest chapters in American history.

annotations.reason: Appealing to national pride and moral authority to justify a position.
annotations.text: which has helped us to regain our position of leadership in the struggle for universal human rights—the struggle upon which this country was founded, and which remains its highest aspiration.

annotations.reason: Using John McCain's authority to influence opinion without further evidence.
annotations.text: Americans who value the Constitution should take this rare moment to agree with McCain.

annotations.reason: The use of 'Muslim Extremists' evokes fear and prejudice.
annotations.text: Armed ‘Muslim Extremists’

annotations.reason: Describing the compound as 'filthy' uses emotive language to create a negative image.
annotations.text: ‘Filthy’ New Mexico Compound

annotations.reason: Labeling the individuals as extremists without context is name-calling.
annotations.text: Muslim Extremists

annotations.reason: The White House used their authority to set rules without consulting journalists, which is an Appeal_to_Authority fallacy.
annotations.text: the administration used the occasion to lay down a set of formal rules governing reporters’ behavior at future White House news conferences, a highly unusual step.

annotations.reason: Labeling Acosta as disrespectful while ignoring Trump's behavior questions his credibility.
annotations.text: The White House sought to blame Mr. Acosta for behaving disrespectfully, although Mr. Trump often lobs insults at journalists

annotations.reason: Vague rules to avoid scrutiny is an Obfuscation technique.
annotations.text: These rules give the White House far too much discretion to avoid real scrutiny.

annotations.reason: Implying severe consequences minimizes the actual impact, an Exaggeration/Minimisation technique.
annotations.text: the onus was on the press corps to ensure that a “code of conduct” did not become necessary.

annotations.reason: The article accuses the police of attempting to tarnish Botham Jean's reputation by highlighting a small amount of marijuana found in his apartment.
annotations.text: Dallas Police Attempt to ‘Smear’ Botham Jean Over Tiny Bit of Weed and they Failed, Miserably

annotations.reason: The timing of releasing the affidavit on the day of Jean's funeral is criticized as an attempt to divert attention from the shooting.
annotations.text: The timing couldn’t have been more insidiously planned as police released the affidavit on the day of Jean’s funeral—despite having allegedly found the marijuana last week.

annotations.reason: Emphasizing the small amount of marijuana while downplaying other evidence could be seen as exaggeration or minimization.
annotations.text: According to the affidavit, when they searched his home, police claimed to have found 10.4 grams of pot—less than half an ounce.

annotations.reason: The attorney's statement directly accuses the police of attempting to damage Jean's reputation posthumously.
annotations.text: “They [police] immediately began looking to smear him,” attorney Lee Merritt said.

annotations.reason: Focusing on criminalizing the victim with irrelevant details misrepresents the situation, a Straw Man fallacy.
annotations.text: I think it’s unfortunate that law enforcement begin to immediately criminalize the victim—in this case, someone who was clearly was the victim that has absolutely no bearing on the fact that he was shot in his home

annotations.reason: Not releasing information about the shooter's apartment search may sway public opinion against Jean.
annotations.text: Pointing out the glaring nature of the smear campaign was the fact that there has been absolutely zero information released about the warrants conducted on officer Amber Guyger, the killer cop who lived just below Jean.

annotations.reason: Accusing the department of character assassination is a direct attack on their reputation.
annotations.text: Merritt accused the department of conducting a “common assassination attempt on the victim that we often see in law enforcement involved shootings.”

annotations.reason: Diverting attention from the officer's mistake by focusing on the victim's actions is obfuscation.
annotations.text: It is standard procedure for police to dig up dirt on their victims in attempts to smear and assassinate their character to make the killer cops look good in the public eye.

annotations.reason: Questioning Guyger's actions and story casts doubt on her credibility.
annotations.text: What’s more, according to the attorneys for Jean, when Guyger was on the phone with police, she had to go outside to verify the address of the apartment—implying that she knew she was in the wrong apartment from the start.

annotations.reason: Contradictions in Guyger's story are used to cast doubt on her credibility.
annotations.text: Independent witnesses have already come forward to say that they heard this officer pounding on the door and demanding to be let in

annotations.reason: Emphasizing obvious signs like the red mat discredits Guyger's story through exaggeration.
annotations.text: Jean’s family also pointed out that it would have been incredibly unlikely for Guyger to mistake Jean’s apartment for her own as he had a distinct red door mat which would have been enough for the cop to know she was at the wrong place.

annotations.reason: The title uses emotionally charged language to portray John Kerry negatively.
annotations.text: Kerry On Edge As Legacy Crumbles

annotations.reason: Simplifies the causes of the JCPOA's issues by blaming Obama and Kerry without considering other factors.
annotations.text: The JCPOA’s fundamental flaws that President Trump wants fixed include Iran’s ability to block unfettered international inspections, the wiggle room that Iran is exploiting to continue developing and testing ballistic missiles capable of delivering nuclear weapons, and the sunset clause on nuclear enrichment that would provide Iran a clear path to becoming a nuclear armed state after the current restrictions are lifted.

annotations.reason: Uses emotionally charged language to attack Trump's decision.

annotations.reason: Labels the Obama administration as dishonest without evidence.

annotations.reason: Appeals to authority by referencing constitutional processes.
annotations.text: Had Obama followed the Constitution and submitted the JCPOA to the Senate as a treaty in the first place, the JCPOA in its present form almost certainly would not have been approved.

annotations.reason: Uses fear by linking Iran's nuclear program to North Korea's threat.
annotations.text: It bought time to turn into a full-fledged nuclear power under our noses.

annotations.reason: Casts doubt on IAEA's credibility by implying they ignore military sites.

annotations.reason: Links European leaders to the Munich Pact with Hitler, a notorious event.
